Fair Treatment #Flashback, two years ago, the Saturday Telegraph came to get a behind-the-scenes look at Uniting's medically supervised injection centre. Kevin is still on point, no one has ever died here. Support us in our campaign for 'Fair Treatment' and join our mailing list, head to our website www.fairtreatment.org #MSIC #HarmReduction #Prevention #Treatment #Reform #SavesLives #EndTheShame #StopStigma

The Anchor is a FREE resource to support kids whose parents are divorced or separated. Tools include: âœ… Tip sheets for kids, adolescents and parents âœ… Helpful information and videos âœ… Links to other resources to download âœ… Support groups for kids in the same boat âœ… Programs to help parents support kids better âœ… Resources for professionals It's your Anchor in the storm of separation. ğŸ‘‰ğŸ‘‰Find out more: https://lnkd.in/gHCi8Bw8

At Uniting Nareen Gardens Bateau Bay there is a group of ladies who meet every Monday morning to help refugees in Ukrainian. ğŸ˜ They pour themselves a cuppa and then get straight to work knitting beanies with matching scarves and beautiful big rugs for the refugees this winter. ğŸ§¶ â€œWe were told that the majority of the refugees were Ukrainian, and the ladies were delighted to support these families in this way,â€ said Uniting Nareen Gardens Pastoral Practitioner, Lynette Westbury. â€œThese women chose to spend their retirement years helping others, and what joy they bring to many! Giving in this way also brings them happiness.â€ Ms Westbury said one of the group members is legally blind and wanted to help so much that she decided to crochet a rug in light colours from memory. â€œThe result was she crocheted a couple of rugs, beanies and scarves!â€ Every piece of clothing will be donated to the Gosford Refugee Group. Thank you ladies â€“ what an amazing job. ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ #WeAreUniting #AgedCare #community #team #NFP

Exciting times at Uniting! We recently held a Uniting Innovation Masterclass, hosted by our fantastic Social Innovation Hub. ğŸ“ Eighteen of our dedicated practice leaders and operations staff worked tirelessly, tackling pressing issues such as youth mental health and affordable housing. ğŸŒğŸ  What made this process unique? Real-world, hands-on research. Our team reached out to get a diverse array of perspectives, which led to the creation of truly innovative solutions. The program concluded with the team presenting their pitches to Uniting's senior leaders - this journey reflects our our ambition to be a bold and imaginative workforce. We're buzzing with excitement to see where this new wave of innovative solutions will lead us. ğŸš€ #InnovationMasterclass #WeAreUniting #HustleLikeaCorporate #ActLikeaNFP

ğŸ“² Scan the QR code and follow our campaign for Fair Treatment. The campaign was launched in 2018 by the Uniting Church NSW/ACT and Uniting and now includes more than 70 partner organisations. We all want to live in a world where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, including people who use drugs. To achieve this, we need increased access to harm reduction, prevention and treatment services, particularly in rural and regional areas, and a compassionate, health and wellbeing-based response to personal drug possession. Stand with us, and together we can reduce shame and stigma and create positive change for our community. â¤ï¸ #HarmReductionWorks #ReduceStigma #StopShame #HumanCentred #FairTreatment #ThoughtLeadership #HealthandWellbeing

The team at Uniting St Matthews Early Learning recently welcomed the original Yellow Wiggle Greg Page - who officially handed over an automated external defibrillator (AED) as part of his Heart of the Nation charity. ğŸŸ¡ğŸ¤© Heart of the Nation is committed to increasing Australia's cardiac arrest survival rates through education, access to AEDs, and fostering a community where every individual is empowered to act in an emergency. A big thank you to Greg and the Heart of the Nation team. ğŸ‘ #WeAreUniting #NFP #EarlyEducation #Educator #Earlylearning

We are very pleased that a Drug Summit has finally been announced and will be held in October and December in both Sydney and regional areas in NSW. #GoodNewsStory We know that community support for health and welfare-based responses to drug use continues to grow. We thank our Fair Treatment community (you) for uniting with us as we advocate for this opportunity to have an open and honest conversation about alcohol and other drugs and how we treat those who use them. Please follow and share this milestone announcement as we continue our mission for @fairtreatmentau for all. Link to Media Release ğŸ‘‰ https://bit.ly/4bJ4oLw #FairTreatment #HarmReduction #EvidenceBased #HealthFirst #Leadership #ChangeMakers #SocialImpact #SaveTheDate
